abstractText: A 15th-century palm-leaf manuscript of the Cāndravyākaraṇa by the Buddhist grammarian Candragomin, containing the sūtrapāṭha without any commentary. The initial folios are missing, and the surviving portion begins with what looks like the end of Cāndravyākaraṇa 1.4.12 (vido laṭo vā) in a slight modified form (the particle vā is missing); sūtras 13 and 14 as they are found in the printed editions are omitted, and the first complete sūtra is 1.4.15. The manuscript contains all six sections (adhyāyas) of Candragomin's grammar. One remarkable feature is its almost generalised use of a sign for the avagraha marking the elision of an initial short "a" in certain sandhi phenomena.
